Detailed Description

Ringer sounds are higher quality sounds made by the polyphonic chip (For instance, Yamaha MA3) or a traditional ringer. These are non-preset sounds. For instance, they could be stored in flash memory.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CustomRingerAudioReference::Format
 

Sound formats.

Enumerator:
FormatSmaf  SMAF (supported only if MAx YAMAHA chip is present).
FormatMidi  MIDI.
FormatRmd  RMD (not supported).
FormatImelody  Imelody (supported only if internal polyringer available).
FormatBuzzer  Buzzer (Obsolete, should not be used anymore).
FormatSmafPhrase  SMAF/Phrase-L1 (supported only if MAx YAMAHA chip is present).

Member Function Documentation

SharedPtr< CustomRingerAudioReference > CustomRingerAudioReference::Create (  AudioPlayer::Buffer  buffer,
UINT32  buffer_size,
Format  format,
BOOLEAN  take_ownership
)  [static]
 

Create a new instance.

Parameters:
buffer The sound data. This must be a pointer to a linear address space, so it can not, for instance, be in the FFS. The format supported depends highly on which ringer device (MA2, MA3 or internal polyringer) is available on the target hardware. Refer to the official specification for the details of the sound data's required format. For instance, see the SMAF specification.
buffer_size,: The number of bytes of data pointed to by buffer.
format Sound format of the buffer data.
take_ownership,: This should always be true. It exists only to differentiate this overload from the other create() overload.
Returns:
A new instance.
